page.title: 10TOURISM
page.content: The main tourist attraction lies in the gardens of Howick Hall which are open to the public from June to October each year.The gardens are extensive,having a large collection of rare trees and shrubs.There is also a truely beautiful woodland garden, famous for its rhododendrons; well worth a visit in May and June. An extremely interesting coast-line attracts people interested in geology, bird-watching,botany and climbing as well as fishing and diving.There is good fishing from the rocks as well as by boat and diving is becoming more popular each year with diving clubs from as far away as Leeds coming regularly.The coastal strip is leased to the National Trust.
